meanings.definition: A neurotransmitter that is involved in the regulation of mood, sleep, and appetite.
meanings.sent1: After exercising, my body releases serotonin, making me feel happier.
meanings.sent2: Doctors sometimes prescribe medication to increase serotonin levels in the brain.
meanings.sent3: The serotonin in my brain must be on vacation today; I feel grumpy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a burst of serotonin, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: I imagine serotonin as tiny messengers in my brain, spreading joy and calmness.

meanings.definition: A chemical substance that is found in the brain and intestines and helps to transmit nerve impulses.
meanings.sent1: Eating foods rich in serotonin can positively impact your gut health.
meanings.sent2: The neurons rely on serotonin to communicate effectively with each other.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled serotonin all over the lab table; hope it doesn't cause any nerve impulses!
meanings.sent4: His words acted like serotonin, transmitting warmth and comfort to her heart.
meanings.sent5: The image of serotonin traveling through the intestines stuck in my mind like a vivid painting.
